title: India draws $52 billion from Amazon, Microsoft in tech expansion
description: Amazon.com Inc. and Microsoft Corp. are intensifying their India push with a combined $52 billion in fresh investment, underscoring the country’s rising status as a key growth market for artificial intelligence, cloud services and online retail.
content:

title: ‘Never trust a machine’: YouTuber gets AI-powered robot to shoot him in the chest, action sparks concerns
description: The video has since gone viral, reigniting a new debate about the use of artificial intelligence and its risks.
content: In the viral video, the YouTuber can be seen handing a high-velocity BB gun to a robot, Max, and directing it to shoot him. Though Max initially refuses to shoot him, citing that he could not perform dangerous actions, the YouTuber orders him to do a... [1036 chars]

title: CBSE Releases Sample Question Paper For Class 12 Artificial Intelligence Exam
description: The paper includes Employability Skills and Subject-Specific Skills, covering communication, ICT, AI concepts, and practical applications like regression and data storytelling.
content:
New Delhi:
The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has released the Sample Question Paper-1 for Artificial Intelligence to empower students navigating the rapidly evolving field of AI. The exam is scheduled on March 24. Designed for Class 12 ... [1681 chars]

title: first tools, say global South experts at Carnegie Tech Summit.
description: At the Carnegie Global Technology Summit 2025, experts from India and across the Global South said the future of artificial intelligence will depend on simple, practical tools that help people in their daily lives. Speaking to ANI at the sidelines of the event, they explained how AI is already shaping public services, health systems and agriculture. They called for stronger collaboration to make these solutions useful for all.
content: New Delhi [India], December 11 (ANI): At the Carnegie Global Technology Summit 2025, experts from India and across the Global South said the future of artificial intelligence will depend on simple, practical tools that help people in their daily live... [2795 chars]

title: Meet Devi Parikh: Former Meta executive of Mark Zuckerberg’s team explains how to build a career in AI without a PhD
description: Meet Devi Parikh, a former Meta executive from Mark Zuckerberg’s AI team, who shares practical insights on building a successful career in artificial intelligence — even without a PhD.
content: You don’t need a PhD to build a successful career in artificial intelligence, says Devi Parikh, the former Meta executive who worked on Mark Zuckerberg’s AI team. In a recent interview with Business Insider, she said that while advanced degrees once ... [2355 chars]

title: Bitcoin price falls below $90,000 amid AI jitters after Oracle results
description: The cryptocurrency’s value falls as poor results from billionaire Larry Ellison’s tech company raised concerns about investment in artificial intelligence
content:
Stock markets in Asia fell and equity futures pointed to the US opening down. Trading was subdued in London and Germany.
Standard Chartered cut its expectations that bitcoin would hit $200,000 by the end of 2025, lowering its forecast to $100,000.

title: Open AI, Microsoft face lawsuit over ChatGPT’s alleged role in Connecticut murder
description: The heirs of an 83-year-old Connecticut woman are suing ChatGPT maker OpenAI and its business partner Microsoft for wrongful death, alleging that the artificial intelligence chatbot intensified her son’s “paranoid delusions” and helped direct them at his mother before he killed her.

title: Bitcoin Plunges Below $90,000 - Why Did It Slump?
description: Bitcoin's surge in 2025 encountered a setback, dipping below $90,000 amid a broader cryptocurrency selloff triggered by concerns over artificial intelligence (AI) investments and disappointing earnings from Oracle. , Economy, Times Now
content:
The world's largest cryptocurrency fell as much as 3 intraday, last trading down 2.5 at 90,056.24, erasing gains from the past two days and extending weakness that began during US trading on Wednesday.
